creator: Satish.Rajgure@adaptive.com
text:
If we pass parameters value as pipe(|) separated values in url it gives 404 error in 8.5.9 version but it works in 8.5.6.
I have attached video for reference.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
An unencoded '|' is not a valid character in any part of the request target.

As part of the fix for CVE-2016-6816, parsing of the request target was tightened. Requests with request targets that contain any characters that are never valid in the request target are now rejected with a 400 response.

creator: Satish.Rajgure@adaptive.com
text: But its working in v8.5.6 and again v9.0.0 then how its not working in v8.5.8 and v8.5 9.

creator: mgrigorov@apache.org
text:
A change in 8.5.8 disallowed such characters in the url when not encoded.
They were allowed by mistake in previous versions.
Please consult with the CVE and the changelog of 8.5.8.

creator: Satish.Rajgure@adaptive.com
text: But it is also working in 9.0.0 version.

creator: mgrigorov@apache.org
text:
Check with latest 9.x (9.0.0-M12 +).
Please ask your questions in the mailing lists.
Bugzilla is not the best place to chat.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
Please review the security pages for information on the versions in which CVE-2016-6816 was addressed.

Please also stop-re-opening this issue. It is invalid. If you persist in doing so, your Bugzilla account will be disabled.
